title: 113_s62
content: The Act titled "Check the Box for Homeless Veterans Act of 2013" establishes a new part in the Internal Revenue Code for contributions to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund. The Act "Check the Box for Homeless Veterans Act of 2013" allows individuals to designate a portion of their tax overpayment to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund or make an additional contribution to the Fund when filing their tax return. Contributions can also be made at other times specified by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Act allows taxpayers to designate a portion of their tax overpayment to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund when filing their tax return. The overpayment designated shall be treated as refunded to the taxpayer and a contribution to the United States. The United States amends the Internal Revenue Code to create the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund. The United States creates the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund under SEC. 9512. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to provide services to homeless veterans through the Department of Veterans Affairs, in consultation with the Department of Labor Veterans' Employment and Training Service and the Department of Housing and Urban Development. The Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund aims to prevent and end veteran homelessness by implementing innovative strategies and supporting programs administered by the Department of Veterans Affairs, Department of Labor Veterans' Employment and Training Service, and Department of Housing and Urban Development. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to transfer funds to support homeless veteran programs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs, in collaboration with the Secretary of Labor and Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, must provide a detailed expenditure plan for the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund to the relevant committees 60 days before any expenditure. Starting from the President's annual budget submission for fiscal year 2014, the use of funds from the previous year and proposed use for the next year must be included in the budget information. The table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding a new item for the next fiscal year. The table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new item for the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years starting after the enactment of this Act.
